greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n into nonzero parts with k parts directly followed by a different part, n>=0, 0<=k<=A004523(n-1).
comment: Same as A238130, with zeros omitted.
For n > 0, also the number of compositions of n with k + 1 runs. - _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 10 2020
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..180, flattened
example: Row n=5 is 2, 10, 4 because in the 16 compositions of 5
there are 2 with no changes, 10 with one change, and 4 with two changes.
maple: b:= proc(n, v) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, expand(
add(b(n-i, i)*`if`(v=0 or v=i, 1, x), i=1..n)))
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0)):
mathematica: b[n_, v_] := b[n, v] = If[n == 0, 1, Expand[Sum[b[n-i, i]*If[v == 0 || v == i, 1, x], {i, 1, n}]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 0]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 11 2015, after Maple *)
xref: The version counting adjacent equal parts is A106356.
The version for ascents/descents is A238343.
The version for weak ascents/descents is A333213.
The k-th composition in standard-order has A124762(k) adjacent equal parts, A124767(k) maximal runs, A333382(k) adjacent unequal parts, and A333381(k) maximal anti-runs.
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 22 2014
